sn12.21:1.2: “Mendicants, a Realized One has ten powers and four kinds of self-assurance. With these he claims the bull’s place, roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and turns the divine wheel.
sn12.21:1.3: Such is form, such is the origin of form, such is the ending of form.
sn12.21:1.4: Such is feeling, such is the origin of feeling, such is the disappearance of feeling.
sn12.21:1.5: Such is perception, such is the origin of perception, such is the disappearance of perception.
sn12.21:1.6: Such are choices, such is the origin of choices, such is the disappearance of choices.
sn12.21:1.7: Such is consciousness, such is the origin of consciousness, such is the disappearance of consciousness.
sn12.21:1.8: When this exists, this comes to be; due to the arising of this, this arises.
sn12.21:1.9: When this doesn’t exist, this doesn’t come to be; due to the cessation of this, this ceases. That is:
sn12.21:1.10: Ignorance is a requirement for choices.
sn12.21:1.11: Choices are a requirement for consciousness. …
sn12.21:1.12: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.21:1.13: When ignorance fades away and ceases with nothing left over, choices cease.
sn12.21:1.15: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”
